net.rim.blackberry.api.options
Class OptionsManager

java.lang.Object
  net.rim.blackberry.api.options.OptionsManager

public final class OptionsManager
extends Object

Manager for option providers.

To add items to the Options screen, invoke OptionsManager.registerOptionsProvider(net.rim.blackberry.api.options.OptionsProvider) to register as an option provider.

For example: OptionsManager.registerOptionsProvider( new myOptionsProvider());

Category:
Signed: This element is only accessible by signed applications. If you intend to use this element, please visit http://www.blackberry.com/go/codesigning to obtain a set of code signing keys. Code signing is only required for applications running on BlackBerry smartphones; development on BlackBerry Smartphone Simulators can occur without code signing.
Since:
BlackBerry API 3.6.0, 3.6

Method Detail

registerOptionsProvider

public static void registerOptionsProvider(OptionsProvider optionsProvider)

Registers an options provider.

Note that registered options providers do not persist past a device reset, so your application should automatically re-register options providers upon startup past a reset.

Parameters:
optionsProvider - Options provider to register.
Category:
Signed: This element is only accessible by signed applications. If you intend to use this element, please visit http://www.blackberry.com/go/codesigning to obtain a set of code signing keys. Code signing is only required for applications running on BlackBerry smartphones; development on BlackBerry Smartphone Simulators can occur without code signing.
Since:
BlackBerry API 3.6.0

registerOptionsProvider

public static void registerOptionsProvider(ExtendedOptionsProvider p)

Registers an extended option provider.

Registered option providers always appear under the third-party applications category of the Options screen.

Note: Registered option providers do not persist past a device reset. After a reset, you should re-register the option providers.

Parameters:
p - The OptionsProvider to be registered.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if p is null.
Category:
Signed: This element is only accessible by signed applications. If you intend to use this element, please visit http://www.blackberry.com/go/codesigning to obtain a set of code signing keys. Code signing is only required for applications running on BlackBerry smartphones; development on BlackBerry Smartphone Simulators can occur without code signing.
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0
